newsitem.title: USA: MRV Communications sees SEC-related charge.
newsitem.headline: MRV Communications sees SEC-related charge.

text.p: MRV Communications Inc said on Tuesday it would take a one-time, non-cash charge of about $4.4 million for the year-ended December 31, 1996, related to a U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission accounting announcement.

The company said the charge would be reflected in its quarters ended September 30 and December 31, but that the previously released pro forma income and earnings per shre results, excluding the charge, would remain the same.

The SEC now required a beneficial conversion feature, attached to instruments convertible into equity, be recognized and measured by allocating part of the proceeds equal to the intrinsic value of that feature to additional paid-in capital and charging it to interest expense, the company said.
The net result of this charge would have no effect on overall stockholders equity as of December 31, it said.
